data.title: Jermaine Dupri’s So So Def Recordings Joins With Creative Music
data.meta_description: Jermaine Dupri, who formed So So Def Recordings, has partnered with Create Music Group for a number of years. Through this deal, So So Def Recordings’ catalogue, publishing rights, and recordings are…
data.text:
Jermaine Dupri, who formed So So Def Recordings, has partnered with Create Music Group for a number of years.

Through this deal, So So Def Recordings’ catalogue, publishing rights, and recordings are brought under the Create Music Group umbrella. It also opens the door for Dupri to lead the release of new songs and artist development programmes.

Grammy Award-winning producer Dupri will become Chairman & Founder of So So Def while still maintaining creative control. According to a statement from the firms, he will also take on the role of Creative Director for Create Music Group, with the goal of increasing the organisation’s influence at the crossroads of music and culture.

Joe Romulus Esq. was appointed Head of Legal Business Affairs, while Bryan Patrick Franklin was chosen CEO of So So Def Recordings.

Dupri is one of the most profitable producers in the music business and was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame. Known for his number-one songs, which include the six-time platinum Mariah Carey song We Belong Together and the three-time platinum Usher song Nice & Slow, Dupri’s time at So So Def Recordings, a number of iconic albums have been produced.
